message: “It's a business, so you're looking at two things: supply and demand,” said Strickland, whose organization is reminding people that January is National Human Trafficking Awareness Month.  “Human trafficking is exploitation,” she said. “It's when one person controls another person for the purpose of exploiting him or her. Something of value must be exchanged.”

data.description: Strickland, founder of Eastern North Carolina Stop Human Trafficking and a nationally known crusader against modern-day slavery, said the reason why is money: It is big business nationally and globally.
data.title: Fighting the good fight against human trafficking - Daily Reflector
